This page was created by the IDL library routine mk_html_help. For more information on this routine, refer to the IDL Online Help Navigator or type: 

     ? mk_html_help

at the IDL command line prompt.

Routine Descriptions

DORON

 [Next Routine] [List of Routines] 
 NAME: doron
 PURPOSE:
  Measure readout noise from a set of CCD images, using the stddev of each pixel

 INPUTS:
  gain ; the CCD gain

 KEYWORDS:
  none

 OUTPUTS:
  ron_e ; the readout noise, in electrons (ron_adu X gain)
  ron_adu ; the readout noise, in adu

 EXAMPLE:
  doron, 0.47, ron_e, ron_adu

 HISTORY:
  Written 2011-04-20 (ish) by Jared Males, jrmales@email.arizona.edu
  2012-05-26. Documentation updated by Jared Males

(See doron.pro)

FOCUSFIT

 [Previous Routine] [Next Routine] [List of Routines] 
 NAME: focusfit
 PURPOSE:
 	Find best focus as defined by max counts, with a 2nd-order polynomial fit.

 INPUTS:
	Two vectors containing (1) the focus positions and (2) the peak PSF counts

 KEYWORDS:
	res = 1000.     ; inverse resolution - array length of findgen for where focus is max
					; (optional) (default is 1000.)
	/verbose        ; print messages
	/plotit         ; plot it  -- including lines showing best focus position, and errors in fit

 OUTPUTS:
	Best-fit focus position

 EXAMPLE:
	print, focusfit(positions, counts, res=1000., /verbose, /plotit)

 HISTORY:
 	Written 2012-02-15 by Katie Morzinski ktmorz@arizona.edu
  2012-02-22 Added units to plot axes.  Jared Males, jrmales@email.arizona.edu

(See focusfit.pro)

FOCUSPHOT

 [Previous Routine] [Next Routine] [List of Routines] 
 NAME: focusphot
 PURPOSE:
 	Find photometry of star for focusing (finds peak counts).
   If "window" is in FW1, then finds the peak counts of the fainter of the two stars.
 DESCRIPTION:
   Finds star(s) above some brightness threshold (5-sig above median); measures peak brightness.

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
   peak_counts = focusphot(im)
 EXAMPLE:
	print, focusphot(image, /fw1window)

 CATEGORY:
   Image analysis

 INPUTS:
	2-d image from VisAO camera.

 KEYWORD INPUT PARAMETERS:
	/fw1window		; optional: If filter wheel 1 is the window, enter that here, so we can centroid on the fainter image.

 OUTPUTS:
	Peak counts

 RESTRICTIONS:
   Requires NASA GSFC IDL library (http://idlastro.gsfc.nasa.gov/)
           (Uses find.pro, which calls getopt.pro)
   Assumes unsaturated data (assumes star has a Gaussian profile)

 MODIFICATION HISTORY:
 	Written 2012/04/25 by Katie Morzinski ktmorz@arizona.edu

 BUGS/WISH LIST:
   Not yet tested on actual VisAO images.
   I believe find.pro is returning the flux for a Gaussian-fit to the star.
           The flux value returned for the Keck image I tested is (very) slightly higher than the Max of the image.
   What FWHM should we use?

(See focusphot.pro)

IM_LIST

 [Previous Routine] [List of Routines] 
 NAME: im_list
 PURPOSE:
  Read a list of fits images into an IDL array

 INPUTS:
  none

 KEYWORDS:
  none

 OUTPUTS:
  im ; the array of images

 EXAMPLE:
  im_list, im

 HISTORY:
  Written 2011-04-20 (ish) by Jared Males, jrmales@email.arizona.edu
  2012-05-26. Documentation updated by Jared Males

(See im_list.pro)
